title: Infrastructure Analyst
description:
The Bristan Group has partnered with Robert Walters Technology. They are keen to appoint an Infrastructure Analyst to work closely with the Technology Team to ensure that IT services are developed and provide the support and delivery of key services.

You will work closely with the IT Operations Manager and the rest of the team to ensure upkeep of day to day activities, IT Projects and delivery of IT strategy.

You will act as a trusted advisor, requiring the assessment, configuration and maintenance of the technological infrastructure systems to ensure they meet business needs. In addition, you will hold accountability for Implementation of hardware and software, infrastructure and cyber security support.

The role is based out of the Tamworth offices, offering a hybrid model, paying a salary range of £45,000 to £50,000 plus bonus and benefits.

The Bristan Group: About Us

The Bristan Group is the leading UK supplier of wash space solutions through Channel partnerships. They have been supplying Brassware, Sanitary ware and Bathroom furniture to the UK markets such as luxury homes and hotels, hospitals and schools to an array of centres and accommodations.

With more than 75 years of combined design and engineering expertise, they are recognised as true industry leaders. They have awarded winning solutions, with exceptional customer service at the very core of their service.

The Role: Infrastructure Analyst

As an experienced Implementation & Infrastructure Analyst, you will report directly into the IT Operations Manager with skills in the following areas:

Duties: Infrastructure Analyst

  • Engage 3rd party suppliers
  • Estimation and capacity planning
  • Deliver infrastructure roadmap
  • Identify and implement best practice
  • Handle escalated incidents
  • Product technical IT support documentation
  • Design and implement automation opportunities
  • Troubleshoot/Resolve technical issues

Experience: Infrastructure Analyst

  • Experience with Azure Cloud – Deploy, Maintain applications and services, Monitor and Troubleshoot
  • Develop and maintain scripts for automated deployment
  • Create and update documentation for Azure environment
  • Experience with on prem and public cloud environments
  • Scripting – PowerShell and PowerShell DSC
  • Git
  • Server – Windows, Linux, VMware
  • Active Directory, Office 365
  • Desktop as a Service – AVD
  • Networking – TCP/IP, Firewalls, LAN, WAN
  • Azure certification: Azure Fundamentals Azure Administrator AZ-900, AZ-104, MS Identify & Access Administrator SC-300

If you’re an ambitious Infrastructure Analyst looking to make your mark for an industry leader, we want to hear from you.

For further information, please apply with an updated CV and contact Ajay Hayre on ajay.hayre@robertwalters.com or 07771507035.

All third-party applications will be forwarded to Robert Walters.

Robert Walters Operations Limited is an employment business and employment agency and welcomes applications from all candidates


The Bristan Group has partnered with Robert Walters Technology. They are keen to appoint an Infrastructure Analyst to work closely with the Technology Team to ensure that IT services are developed and provide the support and delivery of key services.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Ref: 08012024VSNFI42_1704730252

SQL Database Administrator

England

  • £50,000 to £65,000 GBP
  • Administrator Role
  • Level: Mid-level

Job description

SQL Database Administrator

08012024VSNFI42_1704730252

I'm looking for an experienced SQL Server Database Administrator to join a 3 x Microsoft Gold Certified Managed Services Provider, who specialise in DBA and development work. They are a relatively small and close-knit company, who operate on a fully-remote basis, with quarterly meet ups to get together, socialise, and celebrate their successes!

Reporting into their Technical Team Lead, you will work as part of a growing team of DBAs to support their clients with both their on-premises and Azure-based servers, as well as helping with any migration projects where relevant.

This role is client-facing, so would be suited to someone who enjoys building relationship, solving problems, and providing exceptional customer service in everything that you do. Everyone on the team takes their turn being on-call, so realistically you can expect to spend 1 week in every couple of months on call (exact rota to be confirmed).

This is a really unique and exciting opportunity to join a successful organisation who are very much involved in the Microsoft community - they are home to a Microsoft MVP, are active participants at SQLBits, and have previously been nominated for a coveted Women in Tech Award.

In return for your hard work, you can expect to receive significant training support towards your Microsoft Certifications, as well as the freedom to explore your areas of interest.

Requirements

  • Strong SQL Server DBA experience, on-premises and ideally on Azure too
  • Experience working on migration projects to Azure would be beneficial
  • Any experience with SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI would be beneficial
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Benefits

  • Salary between £50-65,000 depending on level of experience
  • 10% matches pension
  • 25 days annual leave, and additional day off for birthday
  • 2 volunteering days per year
  • Paid certifications & training
  • Fully remote working



Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Company Description


As our Cloud Engineer, you will design, implement, maintain and provide support for our cloud-based systems and applications. You'll be responsible for ensuring that our systems are designed for high availability and performance, and are able to scale to meet the demands of our growing business. The role will require you to work part of a team in developing and maintaining our automated build and deployment processes.

Join us at Greene King the country's leading pub company and brewer, where our mission is to pour happiness into lives and become the pride of great British hospitality. We have something special, deeply rooted in our 220-year brewing and pub history, creating the business we are proudly known for today. Still today our 39,000 strong team are the guardians of what’s wholly British, the pub experience.


Additional Information


In reward for your hard work, you will receive...

A competitive salary, pension contribution as well as:

  • 33 days Holiday – With the opportunity to buy an additional 5 days!
  • Life Assurance – Up to 4 times your salary!
  • Discounted Dental & Health Insurance
  • Discount of 33% for you and 15% for your loved ones on all of our brands – so you enjoy your favourite food and drink at a discount
  • Free employee assistance program – Mental Health, well-being, Financial, and Legal support because you matter!
  • Discount of 50% for you and 25% for your loved ones at our Greene King Inns and hotels. – so, you can enjoy a weekend away without breaking the bank
  • Refer a friend – Who do you know who could be interested in a new role? When they are placed, you could earn up to £1,500 for referring them!
  • Retail discounts – Receive up to 30% of at Superdrug, exclusive discounts with Three mobile along with many more…
  • The chance to further your career across our well-known brands – As one of the industry's top apprenticeship providers, we can provide training and development at each level of your career

Job Description


In your role as Cloud engineer you will...

  • Develop and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure, including virtual networks, storage accounts, and virtual machines
  • Design and implement cloud-based solutions using Azure services such as App Services, Functions, and Logic Apps
  • Monitor and troubleshoot cloud-based applications and services, automate cloud-based deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Implement security best practices for cloud-based applications and services, design and implement cost-effective cloud-based solutions including designing and implement backup and disaster recovery solutions
  • Develop and maintain Azure automation scripts
  • Monitor and optimize cloud-based resources for performance and cost
  • Participate in the design and implementation of cloud-based solutions for customer

What you will bring....

  • Hard working with the ability to work under pressure with the self-motivation and ability to work unsupervised
  • Persistent, tenacious and diligent with keen attention to detail
  • Good customer communication skills
  • Azure Cloud Services, Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Automation
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Knowledge of:

  • Cloud Infrastructure Design, Cloud-based Application Development
  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Linux and Windows Server Operating Systems
  • Software Development / Deployment pipelines
  • Development and DevOps processes
  • Web Application Firewalls
  • Azure Active Directory, Virtual Networks, Storage Accounts, Virtual Machines
  • Cloud Security Best Practices, Resource Optimization, Scalability, Performance Monitoring, Cloud-based Solution Implementation
  • Backup and Disaster Recovery
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Qualifications


Qualified in / studying towards relevant qualifications for role or equivalent

  • Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
  • Microsoft Azure Administrator
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Design
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies

title: 2nd Line Support Engineer
description:
2nd Line IT Support Engineer

Bold IT are a well-established IT managed services provider with a proven track record of delivering exceptional service since 1993. We provide project delivery, IT support, business telecoms and cyber security to over 120 businesses nationwide and internationally.

A Microsoft Solutions partner, certified to ISO 9001 and Cyber Essentials; we are looking for engineers with a passion for IT who are excited to be a part of our growing team.

This exciting role will place you at the heart of a fast-growing and agile MSP which has experienced 80% year on growth in the B2B sector, providing successful candidates with the ideal environment to develop their skills and career.

Job Description:

This role will work closely with the technical director and service delivery manager to assist them in providing high-quality support, both remotely and on-premises, when required. In addition, you will be involved in various infrastructure projects, such as server migrations, network configurations and VoIP installations. Candidates with experience providing cyber security and Azure to customers are also desirable.

Essential Skills

· A minimum of 3 years previous experience within an IT support position, preferably with an IT MSP.

· Experience in delivering Cyber Security solutions, such as SATT, dark-web monitoring and cloud based infrastructure monitoring

· Excellent Office 365 knowledge (including One Drive, SharePoint & Exchange)

· Experience in deploying and troubleshooting Windows OS for both servers and workstations

· Strong understanding of Active Directory and Hyper-V configuration and management.

· Experience with helpdesk PSAs/RMM systems

· Network device installation such as printers, firewalls, switches and routers.

· Desktop & Laptop repair and troubleshooting

· DNS, DHCP, VPN, LAN, WAN troubleshooting and implementation

· Full UK driving license and access to own vehicle

· Able to work to industry best practise standards

· Experience in migrating on-premises infrastructure to the cloud

· A strong understanding of Firewalls and networking (Palo Alto & Ubiquiti desirable)

Desirable Skills

· VoIP implementation and management

· Experience in providing cyber security

· Microsoft Azure experience including AZ-104 certification

· Disaster recovery planning and monitoring

· Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert (MS-101 & MS-102)

· Server 2012 R2, 2016, 2019 & 2022 administration

Personal Attributes:

The candidate must possess a strong work ethic, be passionate about IT, and commit to self-directed learning to obtain industry qualifications. A high level of interpersonal skills and an ability to communicate effectively with our customers is vital to the role. Working independently with great attention to detail is also considered essential.

Candidates must possess a current UK driving license and have access to their own vehicle.

Compensation:

£28,000 to £32,000 per annum depending on experience + bonuses

Training, both In-house and with 3rd parties

Microsoft Certification costs covered

Paid annual leave on your birthday

Free Parking

Career development and career path planning.

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £28,000.00-£32,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme
  • Commission pay
  • Yearly bonus

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Tamworth, B77 4DU: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • GCSE or equivalent (preferred)

Experience:

  • Technical support (in an MSP): 3 years (required)

Work Location: In person

title: System Engineer
description:
About the Role:
How you will contribute:

  • Work closely with the Infrastructure IT team and other relevant departments to understand their requirements and translate them into practical and effective IT solutions.
  • Contribute to the ongoing evaluation and implementation of new technologies and tools, recommending appropriate additions or enhancements to the existing infrastructure. Additionally, the role will involve monitoring system performance, conducting routine maintenance tasks, and implementing security protocols to safeguard against potential threats.
  • Executing and overseeing the deployment of hardware and software solutions, as well as integrating them into the existing infrastructure.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain VMware infrastructure, ensuring efficient virtualization and resource utilization
  • Implement and manage multi-factor authentication solutions for enhanced security across various systems and applications.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain Windows Server 2016, 2019 and 2022 infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance and security.
  • Manage and monitor Endpoint security Platforms including detection and respond to advanced threats.
  • Implement and maintain web and reverse proxy solutions, ensuring secure and reliable access to internal and external resources.
  • Oversee, configure and manage email security and threat protection platforms
  • Implement and manage backups and replication using platforms such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto for replication and disaster recovery purposes in Tier 4 datacenter environments.
  • Participate in an on-call Rota, providing remote support, incident management, and problem resolution following ITIL processes.
  • Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies, proactively making recommendations for improvement.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders and IT teams to design and deploy new systems and technologies that meet the organization's needs and objectives. This involves analyzing requirements, selecting appropriate hardware and software, and configuring systems for optimal performance.
  • Overseeing the installation, configuration, and maintenance of servers, both physical and virtual, to support various applications and services. They ensure servers are up-to-date, secure, and perform at their best capacity.
  • Implementing security measures and protocols to safeguard the organization's IT infrastructure from potential threats and cyberattacks. This may include setting up firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and access controls.
  • Constantly monitoring the health and performance of IT systems to identify and address potential problems proactively. They may perform routine maintenance tasks, apply software updates, and optimize configurations.
  • Investigating and resolving technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components. Troubleshooting may involve diagnosing problems, working with vendors, and collaborating with other IT specialists to find solutions.
  • Implementing and managing data backup strategies to ensure data integrity and availability. They may also create and maintain disaster recovery plans to minimize downtime in case of system failures or emergencies.
  • Maintaining comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures. They may also generate reports on system performance, security incidents, and other relevant metrics.
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies and trends in the IT industry. They assess the potential benefits and drawbacks of new technologies to make informed recommendations to the organization.

Your Key Skills/Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
  • Certifications such as ITIL Foundation, CompTIA A+, Net +, Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, or similar, VMWare VCP.
  • Passionate individual with strong proactive work attitude, self starter, adaptable who welcomes challenge and problem solving
  • Solid experience in managing and maintaining Windows Server environments.
  • Strong knowledge of Endpoint protection for threat detection and response.
  • Proficiency in web and reverse proxy technologies, such as Nginx or Apache.
  • Experience in implementing and managing web security and cloud services such as Zscaler.
  • Deep understanding of Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, and DHCP.
  • Familiarity with email security platforms, their administration and deployment.
  • Working knowledge of Certificate Authorities and digital certificates.
  • Experience with Azure cloud services and Office365 administration.
  • Proficiency in backup and replication technologies, such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto.
  • Solid understanding of VMware infrastructure and virtualization technologies, particularly in Tier 4 datacentre environment

Compensation
DP World offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally, stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.

About DP World
Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.
With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 103,000 employees spanning 75 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.
We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades. The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.
What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.
WE MAKE TRADE FLOW
TO CHANGE WHAT'S POSSIBLE FOR EVERYONE
DP World is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their true, authentic selves. So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize DP World to transmit and store your information in the world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Job Segment: Logistics, Systems Engineer, Supply Chain, System Administrator, Cloud, Operations, Engineering, Technology

Work Location: Hybrid remote

title: Database Administrator
description:
Would you like to work for a dynamic technology company in Nottingham? Data is at the heart of everything we do, and by joining the TDX Group we want you to help lead the way by utilising your hands-on DBA skills and expertise!

This is an exciting opportunity to join TDX as we continue our transformation to Google Cloud. This role offers the opportunity to work with public and private sector clients, partner with Google to evolve our software, daily interaction with colleagues across the business including operations, analysts and technology and work on leading technologies.

As well as helping to maintain and improve our existing capabilities (which are primarily Microsoft based - MS SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), we are looking for someone to help drive and shape best practices around how we manage and use our data and partner with our MS SQL Server DBA Team Lead. As our transformation gathers pace we need skilled individuals like you to help us migrate to the cloud, moving and re-shaping our data as we go.

Training opportunities will be provided via Coursera as well as the chance to partner and learn from others. You will also be actively encouraged and sponsored to become Google certified!

About TDX Group - An Equifax Company

We've been a pioneer in the debt recovery industry for over a decade, helping businesses drive fair and appropriate consumer treatment by using data and intelligence.

We meet the exacting standards of our clients who are some of the biggest banking, retail and utility names as well as the UK government. The key to TDX's success has been the scope to build and deliver industry-leading performance portfolios, combining precise execution with high quality analytical insight and continuous creativity to our partners.

What you’ll do

  • Balance good practice, maintainability, company goals, regulatory requirements, security and user needs into solutions

  • Maintaining the day-to-day availability of all database servers

  • Responsible for implementing and maintaining a strong approach to system monitoring

  • Experience in managing high performance and availability of the databases that support critical business systems in a 24/7 environment

  • You will manage the databases through the entire product lifecycle including design, development, testing and deployment and also run / maintenance tasks (backups, incident management, managing performance etc).

  • Work independently to implement medium-large solutions.

  • Identify and the implement automatable activities in order to improve efficiency and makes recommendations on other areas for improvement

  • Define and enhance quality assurance and quality control processes to reduce the number of production incidents

  • Develop, manage and test back-up and recovery plans

What experience you need

  • MS SQL Server DBA skills; working with SQL20016 to SQL2019

    • Administering and configuring SQL Server for optimal use

    • SQL Maintenance: Backups/Integrity checks/Index Maintenance

    • Using Monitoring tools/Working with SQL Server error logs

    • Experience of TDE and TLS

    • SQL Replication

    • Upgrading/patching SQL Server

    • Experience in complex T-SQL Code

    • Documentation of processes

  • Junior to mid DBA currently

  • Experience of database development in a large complex environment

  • Strong data modeling and design skills, performance tuning of MS SQL Server databases

  • Be available for the on call rota

  • SC clearance is required on joining

What could set you apart

  • Active Cloud Certification strongly preferred

  • Experience of databases in cloud, especially on Google Platform - e.g. Cloud SQL, Big Query

  • Migration of SQL Databases from Data Centers to Cloud Platforms

  • Working with clients and security teams on yearly security audits

  • Working on large databases that are multiple terabytes in size

  • Understanding of MS SQL Server BI toolset - SSAS (OLAP Cubes), SSIS, SSRS

  • GITHub and Jenkins experience

  • Good understanding of agile methodologies

#LI-KB1

title: PHP Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP / Laravel developer to join our Development team. You will be responsible for the build, maintenance and upgrade of websites and applications. If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you.

You will predominantly work on all of our PHP based projects with a focus on maintaining and enhancing our existing Laravel websites.

KEY TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • PHP 7 – Object Orientated
  • MySQL 5.6+
  • HTML5 / CSS3(SASS) / Javascript
  • Responsive Design
  • Laravel / WordPress
  • Version Controlling (Git)
  • Browser / Usability Testing
  • Experience in consuming REST / SOAP API’s

MUST HAVES

  • Participate in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on coding and debugging
  • Write clean code to develop functional web applications
  • Troubleshoot and debug applications
  • Manage cutting-edge technologies to improve legacy applications
  • Collaborate with Front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server side logic
  • Gather and address technical and design requirements
  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Liaise with developers, designers and system administrators to identify new features
  • Team Player with great communication skills
  • An incredible eye for attention

JOB DESCRIPTION

ATTITUDE & APPLICATION

  • Take responsibility for the performance and delivery of your own work
  • Be willing to put in extra work and time when it is required to get the job done
  • Be organised and effectively mange your time and workload
  • Actively research and learn to ensure you are consistently at the forefront of technology
  • Contribute to the good atmosphere of the company by being friendly and helpful with others

FIFTEEN SKILLS

Ability to live by the Fifteen culture and values: Mutual respect, listen, have fun, ability to innovate and exceed customer expectations on time every time.

HOURS AND ENVIRONMENT:

  • Monday to Friday, 9am to 5.30pm based at the Fifteen Office. The role may also involve visiting clients.
  • We pay very competitive salaries, in addition to a wide range of benefits such as holiday incentives, financial bonuses, fun days and nights out and a place to work where you can have fun.
  • The culture here at Fifteen offers a friendly and welcoming place to work, where we have a mutual respect for each other. We listen and care about each other. You can have fun with our table tennis and arcade game.

APPLICATIONS

If you have the knowledge and skills to manage this important part of our business, email careers@fifteendesign.co.uk

title: Database Administrator
description:
SQL Server Database Administrator / DBA

Burton upon Trent / Hybrid Working

c£45,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits
We’re looking for an experienced SQL Server DBA to join an awesome IT Team based in Burton upon Trent to manage the development and support of MS SQL Databases that support their applications. Delivering a first-class service, you will ensure the optimal performance and security of all production databases, advise of potential risks and mitigations, and proactively take steps to ensure smooth performance.

We are looking for strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, along with;
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • In-depth SQL Server Database Administration experience
  • Experience of managing multiple MS SQL 2014 & MS SQL 2016
  • Strong self-sufficiency and initiative working on projects
  • Practical experience monitoring and tuning a database to provide high availability service
  • Experience of Transactional SQL and DTS stored procedures
  • Practical experience in managing the internal and external MS SQL database security
  • Experience with High Availability Databases

Working as part of a multi-discipline team, the role includes;
  • Responsibility for ensuring availability and performance of the databases
  • Working to ensure that the associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and a high resilience (including performance tuning as required)
  • Proactively monitoring database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime (SQL Server 2014 & SQL Server 2016)
  • Responsibility for providing meaningful analysis to support any informed decisions regarding resource management
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving in the SQL environment
  • Taking ownership and to be the point of contact for escalated queries in the event of issues
  • Responsibility for Installation, configuration and upgrading of Microsoft SQL Server software and related products (for example SSRS)
  • Responsibility for implementation and release of database changes, service packs etc. according to agreed timescales and costs
  • Establishing and maintaining sound backup and recovery policies and procedures
  • Responsible for restoration of the environment in the event of invoking Disaster Recovery
  • Implementing and maintaining database security (create and maintain users and roles, assign privileges)
  • Application Support for various applications, for example Dynamics NAV 2018 & EDI data flows
If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Database Administrator
description:
A young and rapidly expanding company we are growing our technical team. We are looking for a skilled SQL Server DBA Consultant to come on board and join our highly experienced team of Database Administrators who have a proven track record in delivering market leading Database Managed Services.


Your role will be to provide DBA support and Strategic Consultancy through remote and onsite delivery.


Required Skills:


  • Expert SQL Server skills (additional Oracle knowledge advantageous)
  • At least 4 years’ Database Administration experience
  • Ability to communicate with all levels within the customer environment, up to and including C-Level
  • Capability to generate confidence in your technical proficiency
  • Ability to recognise the opportunity for ongoing services and to position accordingly with the customer
  • Multiple version capability with understanding of future technology road-map
  • Expertise in complex environments - i.e. Virtualised and Clustered Systems
  • Expertise in High Availability architectures and setting up back-up and recovery procedures
  • Excellent written skills and report production a must

Key Responsibilities:

  • To deliver work in adherence with security and operational processes
  • To be reliable, punctual and to work with agreed service level agreements
  • To help develop and mentor junior members of the technical team

  • Company pension
  • Lap-top & phone
  • Expenses

title: IT Support
description:
IT Support Analyst & Office 365 Lead

Circa £38,000

Coventry, On-site


Who we are?


At LEVC we have been transformed from a traditional vehicle manufacturer of the iconic black cab, into a modern electric vehicle company with high performing tech. We operate a green global footprint, with offices and operations across Europe and key overseas markets. The TX electric taxi heralded a new generation of personal transport, bringing zero-emissions-capable operation to cities around the world.

Why work at LEVC?

Our talented team are dedicated to driving green transport solutions that will accelerate the journey to cleaner cities. With our principle ‘Sustainable Innovation’ at the heart of everything we do, we’re proud of what we’ve achieved already and excited to bring and develop talent into the EV industry. 2024 promises to be another exciting year with all the foundations in place to embark on an ambitious growth journey.

About the role

The IT Support Analyst & Office 365 Lead will provide 1st & 2nd line support and additionally, take a lead in the O365 User Administrator duties. Responsible for providing technical support and maintaining the efficient operation of our information technology systems, with a focus on O365 administration, including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory. You will serve as the first point of contact for all IT-related issues and play a critical role in ensuring the smooth functioning of our technology infrastructure. This role requires technical, communication and collaboration skills, to work effectively with both business and IT Teams.

Help design and drive O365 strategy and usage across the company.

Take a lead role in O365, administering user accounts, permissions, and access rights for including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory.

Provide 1st& 2nd line support for all IT-related issues and inquiries from employees across the organization

Document and maintain accurate records of support requests, resolutions, and system configurations


Experience to succeed


Relevant experience in a 1st & 2ndline computer & associated service role

ITIL v4 Foundation desirable

Good communication skills

Microsoft accreditation in Windows 10/11 &/or Office 365 are desirable

Experienced supporting a sizeable, fast-moving business

Knowledge and experience in the fields of collaborative services, especially the configuration & optimisation of smart devices/mobile computing, video conferencing systems & printing


What we can offer you

Competitive salary


25 days’ annual leave plus bank holidays


Life insurance, cycle to work scheme, and a salary sacrifice pension scheme

Health and wellbeing support, including Medicash health care scheme, Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7 365 days and network of mental health first aiders.

Salary extras giving you discounts across various retailers (e.g supermarkets, eating out, and leisure activities.)

Modern offices with free parking and EV charging

Offices include use of onsite gym (Ansty location), subsidised canteens, regular companywide events

Dedicated Learning & Development team help you to unlock your potential through technical & behavioural training. Oh, and did we mention you can get access to LinkedIn Learning too!

At LEVC, whatever your role, you truly have the opportunity to join a team that helps you perform at your best.

title: Property Administrator
description:
Manston Investments Ltd is looking for a Property Administrator to join our business at a very exciting time in its long-term development. We are looking to appoint an enthusiastic and diligent individual to join our Property Team, working alongside and supporting the Head of the Property Department and in-house Building Surveyor, to assist in all matters of portfolio and property administration. This recruitment is to replace a long standing member of staff who is taking retirement after 18 years with the firm.

The role would be ideal for a detail-oriented individual with an understanding of the management requirements of commercial property assets. Similarly, you will enjoy not having a rigid structure to your day and be able to respond appropriately to changing priorities whilst taking responsibility for managing your workload – you will enjoy taking (and being recognised for taking) the initiative and seeing tasks through to completion.

Responsibilities would include:

· Maintaining accurate records within the property department, both paper copies and on shared server/databases.

· Liaising with tenants/professional advisors/tradesmen as required on property, leasing & management issues.

· Overseeing & managing tenancy paperwork & correspondence

· Responsibility for arrangement of all routine statutory works – e.g. arranging routine fire alarm, boiler, gas testing & services, etc.

· Managing the oversight of property/lettings issues as overseen & directed by the Head of Department.

· Providing support to the Head of the Property Department and in-house Building Surveyor

· Overseeing the management of the property department’s process documentation.

· Undertaking & collating basic property & market research, as required, under the direction of the Head of Department.

· Ad hoc minute taking for departmental & board meetings.

Requirements for the role:

· Background in administration & managing documentation

· Comfortable dealing with external parties, both verbally & in writing, in a professional manner

· Attention to detail & a diligent approach to work

· Discreet

· Knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly word, outlook and excel.

Whilst not a strict necessity – experience of working with, or managing commercial properties (on either an agency, in-house or 3rd party management basis) would be a valuable attribute in a candidate, as would any specific experience of Yardi, CoStar (or similar property systems). Knowledge of service charge administration would be considered of particular interest, albeit not vital, in any candidate.

Manston Investments pride ourselves on being a very open organisation and it is expected that the successful candidate would be integral to the development of further growth strategies and maintain a good working relationship with the Board of Directors, alongside the executive team.

The candidate will report to the Operations Director (Head of the Property Department). Whilst the role is primarily Office/Home based (hybrid working is used across the firm, with a usual pattern of 3 days in the office (Mon, Tues, Weds) and 2 working from home) – there may be some occasional requirement to visit properties in the portfolio, or attend meetings off-site.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £25,000.00-£27,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking
  • Private medical insurance
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme
  • Performance bonus
  • Yearly bonus

Application question(s):

  • Do you have any experience of property management databases such as Yardi, CoStar, etc.?
  • It is envisaged that this role will start towards the end of April (Monday 22nd) - can you confirm that this sits within your timeline?

Experience:

  • Property Management: 2 years (preferred)
  • Administration: 5 years (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

  • Ashby-De-La-Zouch (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Ashby-De-La-Zouch

Application deadline: 03/03/2024
Expected start date: 22/04/2024

title: IT Technician
description:
Full time, open ended position


Come and join IT Services at a UK top 10 university. We are at the forefront of supporting the digital campus, protecting, and securing our IT systems, and developing strategies to take us forward in a rapidly evolving world. Whatever stage you are at in your career, Loughborough University provides a vibrant, dynamic experience. The atmosphere on campus is friendly and relaxed and offers fantastic facilities for staff to use.

Do you have a strong working knowledge of Linux servers in a production environment, UNIX shell (bash), Perl, Python, experiencing of compiling code from source, etc?

We are looking for an IT Services Specialist (Linux System Administrator) with a focus on supporting the HPC service in its expansion to taught-course student users this role will provide specialist knowledge and skills in the support, maintenance, and development of the University's High-Performance Computing (HPC) and other Research HPC infrastructure.

The University HPC is based upon Linux systems including high-performance storage systems and interconnects, and all supporting applications and monitoring systems.

The role will be involved assisting with the full lifecycle of testing, procurement, configuration, deployment, re-configuration, fault finding and decommissioning of server and storage equipment.

As a member of IT Services, you can expect:

  • support in developing your career, allowing you to progress towards your goals in a friendly environment.
  • development opportunities including exposure to a wide breadth of technologies.
  • work closely with all our partners from across the University to support digital transformation and deliver outstanding levels of service that are recognised as the best in the country by our students in the National Student Survey.
  • a supportive dynamic working policy with flexible home/hybrid working where possible.
  • a superb 440-acre green site in the heart of Leicestershire with first-rate facilities, plenty of open space, gardens, and sports areas.
  • a great salary and benefits package, generous holiday allowance and pension scheme.

There is a sense of pride across campus; employees are proud to be part of our continuous success and are an essential part of achieving all that we do. It’s not just students that arrive in Loughborough for the first day of their future - we want our staff to feel the same too.

Diversity of experience, thought and perspective enriches our university and the lives of its community. It is crucial to our ongoing development as an international institution. We strive to create a culture that supports equity and celebrates diversity throughout the campus, and we are actively seeking to make our team more diverse.

Applications for job-sharing, part-time and flexible working arrangements are welcomed and will be considered in line with business needs.

Whatever area of IT you work in, if you’re looking to make things happen then we’re looking for you.

For the full job description and person specification please see here.

Informal chats about the role are welcomed, please contact the Research HPC Team Manager, Julian Highfield via J.C.Highfield@lboro.ac.uk.


Application closing date: 28 February 2024

title: Systems Administrator
description:
There are lots of great things to shout about with this opportunity, but to name a few… Stylish open plan offices, open door policy, flexible working hours, hybrid working model, summer and winter social events and a generous benefits package.

This is a fabulous opportunity for an experienced IT System Administrator to take their Security knowledge to the next level. Your role will be pivotal in ensuring the efficiency and security of all internal IT systems and networks.

Salary: Up to £35,000 per annum

Location: Wigston, LE18 – Hybrid 2 days office p/w

Hours: 35 hours p/w

Generous benefits package.

THE ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Implementing and monitoring computer systems, networks, and cloud platforms within the organisation
  • Providing support for Windows Server, Active Directory, O365, Azure and other
  • Make recommendations for improvement in line with ISO27001
  • Troubleshooting and providing root cause analysis on any system outages
  • Work with the Information Security Officer in creating and adapting business rules, policies, and procedures, in line with ISO27001
  • Act as an escalation point for IT Support tickets, providing 3rd line or infrastructure support where required
  • Implement security protocols and procedures to prevent potential threats
  • Manage and maintain the site security CCTV and Access Control system
  • Manage internal and external penetration and vulnerability tests
  • Administer security-focused systems
  • Proactively research and gain up-to-date industry knowledge on the latest technology trends

ABOUT YOU

  • Knowledge of Microsoft environments, including O365, SharePoint, Azure, Teams, Exchange
  • Knowledge of security and compliance tools within the Microsoft Security compliance centre
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to manage relationships with third parties and suppliers
  • The ability to create automation scripts within PowerShell
  • Experience in information security systems, including compliance with the GDPR and Cyber Essentials framework
  • Understanding of ITSM framework
  • A methodical approach to problem-solving
  • Highly organised and the ability to work well under time constraints

If this role and business sounds like something you’d love to be a part of, please get in touch/APPLY to find out more information. Alternatively find me on LinkedIn – Lois Knight @ Distinct Recruitment.

*Distinct Recruitment are always open to ideas from our candidates, ideas that help us to make our recruiting services more accessible. Just let us know if you have any accessibility requirements, at any stage of the application process*

Benefits:

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Company Description

Come join us and make a difference in the world!

Discover more at www.necsws.com

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Job Description

Please note - this role can be Hybrid from any of our offices across the UK (2-3 Days a week from home).

  • Hartlepool
  • Nottingham
  • Bracknell
  • Hemel Hempstead
  • Alderley Edge
  • Worcester

We are looking for a proven Azure administrator to join our highly talented team of public cloud administrators.

Embark on an exciting career as an Azure Administrator and become an integral part of our team, delivering 24x7x365 support to our valued customer base. Join us during our transition to a cloud-first hosting platform, where you'll get the chance to administer Azure, OCI and AWS. As a cloud administrator, you'll drive change, automation, and innovation in our cloud journey, making a significant impact in the world of technology.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Provide timely incident management, ensuring swift resolution to customer alerts.
  • Manage Azure Active Directory (Microsoft Entra ID) objects
  • Manage role-based access control (RBAC)
  • Manage subscriptions and governance
  • Manage Storage
  • Deploy and Manage Azure Compute Resources
  • Configure VMs
  • Create and configure containers
  • Create and configure Azure App Service
  • Configure/Implement and Manage Virtual Networking
  • Secure access to virtual networks
  • Configure load balancing
  • Monitor and troubleshoot virtual networking
  • Monitor resources
  • Implement backup and recovery

Qualifications

  • Demonstrable experience working with Azure on an Infrastructure/Implementation basis
  • Proficiency in Linux and/or Windows server administration and troubleshooting.
  • Experience with automation tools like Ansible and Terraform would be an advantage
  • Strong command-line configuration and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities.
  • Self-motivated and capable of working independently or collaboratively.
  • Exceptional customer service skills with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Ability to manage a diverse workload effectively.
  • Eligible for UK Security Clearance

Desirable:

  • Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-103)
  • Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-104)
  • Microsoft Azure Architect (AZ-305)

Join our team, where you'll provide outstanding support, drive innovation, and contribute to our cloud adoption journey. Be part of an environment that thrives on cutting-edge technologies, pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved in the cloud. Take the next step in your career and seize this opportunity to make a lasting impact in the world of cloud engineering.

Additional Information

We pride ourselves in offering an excellent benefits package, including an above average pension scheme. When you join the team at NEC Software Solutions, you are provided with the following:

  • Private Medical Cover funded by NEC for Employees (with the option to add family members at an additional cost)
  • 25 days paid holiday with the option to buy/sell
  • 4 x basic salary life assurance cover funded by NEC (with the option to increase cover at an additional cost)
  • A Group Pension Plan with fantastic employer contributions up to a maximum of 8.5%
  • A selection of flexible benefits to suit your individual needs
  • All colleagues get free access to LinkedIn Learning. Over 15000 courses covering a huge breadth of subjects. Learn about what you like, when you like, how you like.

OTHER INFORMATION

Candidates must be able to demonstrate a pre-existing right to work and travel within the UK. Documentary evidence will be required.

All offers are subject to satisfactory vetting and reference checks. Depending on the nature of the role a Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check may also be required.

NEC is an equal opportunities employer, welcoming applications from all communities.

Who We Are:

We’re NEC Software Solutions (part of global tech giant NEC Corporation). While you read this ad, our software is helping to dispatch ambulances, support families, keep trains on the move, locate missing people and even test the hearing of newborn babies.

Working with us, you’ll be helping our 3,000+ employees push the boundaries of what’s possible and support amazing public services.

We work with governments, hospitals, police forces, housing providers, local authorities and more. We help them pay financial support faster, speed up treatments for patients and respond to emergencies in the right way. The more we do, the more our customers can do for others. And together, we make a world of difference.

We’d love your help. And we’ll support you all the way.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Great role, great team, great location - on the Coventry University Technology Park.

Exasoft Group, formed in 1993 incorporates financial, digital and educational divisions. Based in modern offices on the Coventry University Technology Park our award-winning rectification software is utilised by the UK’s top banks, building societies and financial organisations.

Our digital division provides web and digital solutions for a wide range of clients including Coventry City of Culture and Game, and our educational division works with leading Universities nationally and Internationally.

We are an Umbraco certified partner, a Microsoft Silver partner, ISO 9001 & 27001, IIP (Investors in people) and a Queens Award recipient 2006.

Our Benefits:

Bonus scheme after 1 years service

Flexible working hours

Free Healthcare after 1 year

Company events & social hours

Pension matched up to 5%

Decent coffee, free biscuits

Central location, Hybrid working

We are seeking a software developer to join a great team.

Your skills - C#, . NET, Blazor and SQL Server

Ideally you will also have Xamarin and/or Umbraco (training will be given)

Are you looking for a fantastic role where you’ll get to utilise your skills, learn new ones, work with amazing clients and have fun along the way?

Join the Exasoft Group and you’ll have the opportunity to work across our three divisions Digital, Educational and Finance.

Digital: You’ll get to work on innovative websites, web applications and mobile applications for SME's, mid and large companies. We pride ourselves on delivering well managed solutions for clients utilising the latest design / development techniques.

Education: We have our own SAAS applications and these are used around the globe.

Finance: Our finance solutions are utilised by the UK's top banks, building societies and life assurance companies.

We are a talented team with an in-house development team, comprising of testers, PM's, BA's, designers, developers and system administrators.

Our company mantra is we’re only as good as our employees which is why we invest in their development, have regular performance reviews and organise regular social events to encourage staff to relax and mix. It’s important that we get the right people for our team so at interview stage you’ll get the opportunity to meet our CEO and understand the contribution you’ll be making to the organisation’s overall vision.

Your role will be to join our team of developers, working on a mixture of exciting projects built from the ground upwards.

We’re looking for core skills including; good C#, .NET and Blazor experience, working on web based solutions, and great communication and team player skills.

Please apply or email for an informal chat. We have friendly HR also.

No agencies please and please do not re-apply.

Hybrid working - 3 days per week in office

Salary: Up to £50,000.00 per year

  • Company pension
  • Life insurance
  • Private medical insurance

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Experience:

  • .net: 3 years (required)
  • C#: 3 years (required)
  • Blazor: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: In person
